stories.title: Fred

stories.text:
So I was wanting to replace Google Search for a long time due to the poor results filled with ads and content farmed articles.

I signed up for the Kagi Search beta (kagi.com) and finally received my invite this week.

So far, all the searches that I have tried, I have gotten better results than Google.

DuckDuckGo was something I sometimes used but I would often have to !g a lot of things or feel like I might be missing out on better results. So that would make me also Google search those things.

With Kagi I have not found that till now. In fact the results have been so good that I didn't feel like I needed to also search Google for very important queries.

Amazingly my go to query to test search engines has been "frozen record" without the quotes which I want to point to: https://github.com/byroot/frozen_record.

It is a query which almost every other search engine doesn't quite get since it contains two common words but surprisingly kagi gets it and places the result at number 2 which is huge.

I know a lot of people here have been clamouring for a different search so I thought this might be useful. No relations with Kagi.
stories.title: My Experience with Kagi Search (Google Search Replacement)
Bad but interesting mathematical notation idea

stories.text:
Hi
I'm working for a software company in NY, remotely, they are paying me 40$/h, that, for me, living in Arentina (sorry about my English), is a lot of money, BUT:
I always worked alone, or with some ocational coworker or friend, I code since I was 18 and now I'm 54, so I had to view at my code from years back, so I like to write code that I will understand, I also love coding, so I studied a lot, always for my self, my work was for local clients, so remote working, and in a language that is not mine, is new for me.
I coded since DOS, with basic, clipper, c, pascal, then win windows with visual c and lastley my beloved Delphi, then for the web with php, jquery and then my new beloved, JS, now with VUE which I LOVE since composition!!!
Well, sorry if I'm just now going to the point.
Can you please, please help me to know where I'm positioned, in your opinion, in the market, because I'm feeling insecure about my knowledge, this is my GitLab account, these are some of my projects that ended up there, if you are so kind to take a look and give me your opinion it would be so much for me.
Thanks a lot my friend.
stories.title: I'm not enjoining my job
